tuv.seg: Psychological services for schools
Seirbhís síceolaíochta i scoileanna
The National Educational Psychological Service (NEPS) provides psychological services in public and private primary and post-primary schools and in related educational centres

Soláthraíonn an tSeirbhís Náisiúnta Síceolaíochta Oideachais (SNSO) seirbhísí síceolaíochta i mbunscoileanna agus iar-bhunscoileanna poiblí agus príobháideacha in Éirinn agus in ionaid oideachais ghaolmhara

NEPS is a service of the Department of Education and Skills (DES) and aims to support the personal, social and educational development of all children through the application of psychological theory and practice in education

Is seirbhís í an SNSO faoin Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna agus is í a cuspóir ná tacú le forbairt phearsanta, shóisialta agus oideachais gach linbh trí chleachtas agus theoiric shiceolaíochta a chur i bhfeidhm san oideachas
It has particular regard for children with special educational needs
Tugann an tSeirbhís aird ar leith ar leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
You can read further information about how NEPS services are operated in the booklet Working Together to Make a Difference to Children (pdf) on the DES website
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi reáchtáil seirbhísí SNSO sa leabhrán Ag Obair le Chéile ar Mhaithe le Leanaí (pdf) ar an suíomh gréasaín ROE
The psychologists employed by NEPS are located in 8 regions throughout the country
Tá na síceolaithe a fhostaíonn SNSO lonnaithe i 8 n-áit timpeall na tíre
They work directly with a number of schools and their work includes:
Oibríonn siad go díreach le roinnt scoileanna agus i measc a gcuid oibre tá:
• Engaging in individual casework with children and young people
• Obair a dhéanamh de réir cáis le leanaí agus daoine óga aonair
• Providing a consultation service for teachers and parents
• Seirbhís chomhairliúcháin a sholáthar do mhúinteoirí agus thuismitheoirí
• Participating in school-based projects relevant to educational psychology
• Bheith páirteach i dtionscnaimh scoile a bhaineann le síceolaíocht oideachais
• Promoting mental health in schools
• Sláinte intinne a chur chun cinn i scoileanna
Scheme for Commissioning Psychological Assessments
Sceim le Measúnuithe Pearsanta Síceolaíochta a Ordú (SMPS)
Schools which do not have a service from NEPS can use the Scheme for Commissioning Psychological Assessment (SCPA)
Is féidir le scoileanna atá gan SNSO faoi láthair leas a bhaint as an Scéim le Measúnuithe Pearsanta Síceolaíochta a Ordú (SMPS)
This is an interim measure funding schools to meet the urgent needs for psychological advice while the NEPS service is being expanded to all schools
Is idirbheart í an scéim sin a chuireann maoiniú ar fáil do scoileanna le riachtanais phráinneacha ar chomhairle Síceolaíochta, fad is atá seirbhísí SNSO á leathnú chuig na scoileanna ar fad
Only psychologists listed in the current SCPA Panel 2014-2015 (pdf) are eligible to carry out work under the SCPA scheme
Níl ach síceolaithe atá liostaithe i bPainéal reatha an SCPA 2014-2015 (pdf) i dteideal tabhairt faoi obair faoi scéim an SCPA
Further information on the Scheme for Commissioning Psychological Assessment (SCPA) is available
Tá níos mó eolais ar an Scéim le Measúnuithe Pearsanta Síceolaíochta a Ordú ar fáil anseo
How should children be selected for individual psychological assessment?
Cén chaoi gur cheart leanaí a roghnú le measúnú pearsanta síceolaíochta?
In general, teachers will have noticed those children who have difficulty in coping with the normal curriculum
Is iondúil go bhfuil sé tugtha faoi deara ag na múnteoirí go bhfuil deacrachtaí ag na leanaí sin leis an ngnáth-churaclam a leanúint
Parents should be made aware of any difficulties being experienced by their child in school, long before there is any question of a psychological assessment
Ba cheart aon deacrachtaí atá ag leanbh a chur in iúl do thuismitheoirí tamall fada sula mbeidh sé i gceist measúnú síceolaíochta a iarraidh do leanbh
If required, parents should be encouraged to make arrangements for a check up on the child's general health, hearing and sight
Más gá, ba cheart tuismitheoirí a spreagadh an páiste a thabhairt go dtí an dochtúir lena s(h)láinte ghinearálta, éisteachta agus radharc na súl a scrúdú
Before commissioning an individual psychological assessment for a child, school staff should explore the avenue of supplementary teaching
Roimh measúnú pearsanta síceolaíochta a ordú do leanbh, ba cheart d'fhoireann na scoile breathnú ar mhúinteoireacht bhreise mar rogha
If the school decides that an assessment is required for a particular child, the principal or a nominated teacher should arrange a personal interview with parents and/or legal guardians

Má dhéanann an scoil an cinneadh go bhfuil gá le measúnú do pháiste faoi leith, ba cheart don phríomhoide nó do mhúinteoir ainmnithe agallamh pearsanta a shocrú leis an thuismitheoirí agus/nó caomhnóirí dlíthiúla
The reasons for the assessment should be discussed and each section of the consent form for psychological assessment - form 1 (pdf) explained before parents are asked to sign the form
Ba cheart na cúiseanna a bhaineann leis an measúnú a phlé agus gach cuid denfhoirm cheada le measúnú Síceolaíochta (foirm 1) a shíniú roimh iarraidh ar na tuismitheoirí í a shíniú
Psychologists who carry out assessments under this scheme are required to meet the parents
Ní mór do na síceolaithe a dhéanann measúnú faoin scéim seo buaileadh leis na tuismitheoirí
They will explain their findings to the parents and will give them a copy of the psychological report
Míneoidh siad torthaí an mheasúnaithe do na tuismitheoirí agus cuirfidh siad cóip den tuairisc shiceolaíochta ar fáil dóibh
You can get a NEPS information leaflet for parents (pdf)
Is féidir an bhileog eolais SNSO do thuismitheoirí a íoslódáil anseo
The protection of children's interests
Leasa leanaí a chosaint
Although this scheme is in place so that children with special learning needs may take advantage of the necessary resources, many children will grow nervous at the thought of meeting a psychologist

Cé go bhfuil an scéim seo ann le go mbeidh leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu in ann tairbhe a bhaint as na hacmhainní cuí, beidh go leor leanaí neirbhíseach má chaitheann siad bualadh le síceolaí
It should also be kept in mind that if a child is aware that they have difficulties at school, the prospect of a meeting with a psychologist may confirm to them a perceived weakness
Ba cheart cuimhniú má tá a fhios ag leanaí go bhfuil deacrachtaí acu ar scoil, go bhfuil gach seans ann go gcuirfidh sé sin isteach ar a muinín má chaitheann siad bualadh le síceolaí
For this reason, a school should only commission an individual assessment if, having spoken with the child's parents, it is absolutely convinced that the result will benefit the child

Mar sin de, tar éis labhairt le tuismitheoirí an linbh, níor cheart do scoil measúnú Síceolaíochta a ordú ach amháin sa chás go bhfuil siad lán-chinnte gur chun tairbhe an pháiste a bheidh an próiseas seo ar fad
NEPS provides advice on whether you should tell your child that his/her learning needs will be assessed by a psychologist
Soláthraíonn NEPS comhairle ar cibé acu ar cheart nó nár cheart duit insint do do leanbh go ndéanfaidh síceolaí measúnú ar a riachtanais foghlama
For the protection of the child's confidentiality, he or she is referred to by his or her initials only in all documentation submitted by school authorities to NEPS
Ar mhaithe le rúndacht an linbh a chosaint, baineann údaráis na scoile úsáid as ceannlitreacha a (h)ainm amháin ar gach cáipéis a chuirtear chuir an SNSO
All psychologists on the NEPS panel must have obtained Garda clearance
Ní mór do gach síceolaí atá ag plé le SNSO cead an Gharda a bheith faighte acu
It is also recommended that a member of the school staff look in on the assessment interview once or twice
Moltar freisin gur cheart do dhuine ar fhoireann na scoile buaileadh isteach sa seomra measúnaithe uair nó dhó le linn an agallaimh
In general, an assessment should be carried out in the child's school, where the surroundings are familiar. A separate room in the main building and near the school office is an ideal venue
Go ginearálta, ba cheart an measúnú a dhéanamh i scoil an linbh, mar a bhfuil cur amach aige/aici ar a t(h)impeallacht agus ina mbeidh sé/sí compordach
The following may commission psychological assessments under the Scheme for Commissioning Psychological Assessment (SCPA):
Is féidir leis na grúpaí seo a leanas iarratas ar mheasúnuithe síceolaíochta a ordú faoin Scéim le Measúnuithe Pearsanta Síceolaíochta a Ordú (SMPS):
• Schools that do not have access to the service provided by NEPS
• Scoileanna nach bhfuil fáil fós acu ar an tseirbhís a chuireann SNSO ar fáil
• NEPS Regional Directors who have some additional, but limited, discretion to meet exceptional circumstances arising in their regions
• Tá discréid bhreise, ach teoranta, ag Stiúrthóirí Réigiúnacha SNSO maidir le déileáil le imthosca eisceachtúla a tharlaíonn ina réigiúin
Payment by NEPS is made directly to the psychologist
Déanann SNSO íocaíocht go díreach chuig an síceolaí
NEPS does not reimburse schools or parents for assessments
Ní aisíocann SNSO scoileanna nó tuismitheoirí as measúnuithe
NEPS cannot reimburse you if you are a parent who has commissioned a private psychological assessment
Ní féidir le SNSO tuismitheoir a aisíoc as measúnú a ordú le síceolaí príobháideach
24-27 North Frederick St Dublin 1
Sa chás seo tá faoiseamh cánach le fáil do na híocaíochtaí sin má úsáideann tú Foirm MED 1 (pdf)
You can find contact information for the NEPS offices in Ireland (pdf)
Go ginearálta déanann tú iarratas ar sheirbhísí SNSO trí phríomhoide na scoile a bhfuil do leanbh ag freastal uirthi
